message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE 

This paper discusses the task of indicative summarization, which involves generating summaries that help a searcher decide whether to read a particular document. This task is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including natural language processing (cs.CL), information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), natural language generation (cs.LG), and neural networks (cs.NE). The paper specifically focuses on using natural language generation techniques to create indicative summaries, which suggests that cs.LG is a likely sub-category. Additionally, the use of document features and topicality to generate summaries is relevant to cs.IR and cs.AI. The paper also mentions the use of neural networks for summarization, which is relevant to cs.NE. Overall, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, and cs.NE are all likely sub-categories for this paper.
